column4: how to make an initrd for the kernel I'm trying to install?  I keep ending up with an initrd for my running kernel.  and while I'm at it, why didn't make install make my initrd for me?
or make-kpkg for that matter
do you need an initrd?
you only need an initrd for modules that are required to read your filesystem (aka ext3 or reiserfs)
well my fs is compiled in.  so I just disable initrd support and rebuild?
you don't need to disable initrd support, just don't include an initrd line in grub.conf
I did try that.  unable to mount rootfs.
I tried including the initrd to solve the problem.  used the wrong initrd and it doesn't contain the new /lib/modules, and I get a very different error.
eh, then you probably compiled the fs driver as a module and you'll need an initrd.
I triple-checked that the fs driver is built in, but I'm happy to build an initrd if I can figure out how to build a good one.
